page.title: 14EDUCATION IN FRILSHAM (1)
page.content: There is no{play school}but under fives go to Hampstead Norreys. Neither is there a state school. With the reallocation of educational resources in the 1970's the{primary school} closed. Children go to Yattendon or Bucklebury until they are 11 when they go onto the Downs{Secondary School}at Compton. After 'O' levels they go on to Newbury{College.}No school transport is provided. During the summer holidays a popular childrens play scheme is run in Frilsham by volunteeers. The well to do parents of the area send their children to {independent schools}such as Ridge House at Cold Ash then onto{boarding {school.}Brockhurst School an exclusive {preparatory school}with a good scholastic reputation is at Marlston. Boys come here from all over the country but high fees preclude locals.
